intro: Guaymasia, commonly known as the Mexican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbing plants. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a rough texture, while its stems are hairy and tend to climb by twining around supports. Guaymasia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
